title: Oldboy
writer: Garon Tsuchiya, Nobuaki Minegishi, Park Chan-wook
movie_plot: After being held captive for 15 years, Oh Dae-su is released and given a five-day deadline to find his captor.
awards: Won Grand Prix at the Cannes Film Festival

title: The Godfather
movie_plot: The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant son.
awards: Won 3 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: Parasite
movie_plot: A poor family's plan to con a wealthy family by posing as highly qualified individuals goes horribly wrong.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: Pulp Fiction
movie_plot: The lives of two mob hitmen, a gangster's wife, a boxer, and two diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.
awards: Won the Palme d'Or at the Cannes Film Festival

title: The Dark Knight
movie_plot: Batman must face a new threat, the anarchistic Joker, who threatens to plunge Gotham City into chaos.
awards: Won 2 Academy Awards

title: Inception
movie_plot: A thief who steals corporate secrets through dream-sharing is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a CEO.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards

title: Spirited Away
movie_plot: During her family's move to the suburbs, a sullen 10-year-old girl wanders into a world ruled by gods, witches, and spirits.
awards: Won the Academy Award for Best Animated Feature

title: Seven Samurai
writer: Akira Kurosawa, Shinobu Hashimoto, Hideo Oguni
movie_plot: A poor village under attack by bandits hires seven unemployed samurai to help them defend themselves.
awards: Won Silver Lion at Venice Film Festival

title: The Matrix
movie_plot: A computer hacker learns from mysterious rebels about the true nature of his reality and his role in the war against its controllers.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
writer: J.R.R. Tolkien, Fran Walsh, Philippa Boyens
movie: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
movie_plot: A young hobbit, Frodo Baggins, inherits a powerful ring and embarks on a quest to destroy it.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards

title: The Silence of the Lambs
movie_plot: A young FBI trainee seeks the help of an incarcerated cannibalistic serial killer, Dr. Hannibal Lecter, to help her catch another serial killer known as 'Buffalo Bill.'
awards: Won 5 Academy Awards, including Best Picture, Best Director, and Best Actor/Actress

title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
writer: Age & Scarpelli, Luciano Vincenzoni, Sergio Leone
movie: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
movie_plot: During the American Civil War, three men--a lone gunslinger, a hitman, and a bandit--form an uneasy alliance to find a hidden cache of Confederate gold.
awards: Inducted into the National Film Registry

title: The Grand Budapest Hotel
movie_plot: The story of Gustave H., a legendary concierge at a famous European hotel between the first and second World Wars, and his friendship with a young lobby boy. The plot centers on the theft and recovery of a priceless painting.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards

title: The Lives of Others
movie_plot: In 1980s East Berlin, a Stasi agent, tasked with spying on a writer and his lover, finds himself increasingly involved in their lives, leading to a profound change of heart.
awards: Won Oscar for Best Foreign Language Film

title: Seven
movie_plot: Two detectives hunt a serial killer who is murdering his victims based on the seven deadly sins.
awards: Nominated for 1 Academy Award

title: A Separation
movie_plot: A married couple is in conflict over whether to leave Iran or stay, which leads to a court case and a new, tense relationship with an in-home caregiver.
awards: Won the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film

title: Amélie
movie_plot: A shy waitress in Paris, with an overactive imagination, discreetly orchestrates the lives of those around her to bring joy and wonder into their mundane existence.
awards: Nominated for 5 Academy Awards

title: Pan's Labyrinth
movie_plot: In post-Civil War Spain, a young girl, escaping the cruel reality of her life with her stepfather, a ruthless Falangist officer, is drawn into an eerie and fantastical world inhabited by magical creatures.
awards: Won 3 Academy Awards

title: Alien
movie_plot: The crew of a commercial space tug is awakened from cryo-sleep to investigate a distress signal from a desolate planet, only to discover a terrifying alien lifeform.
awards: Won 1 Academy Award

title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
movie_plot: Humanity finds a mysterious artifact buried on the Moon, which leads them to a journey to Jupiter with the sentient supercomputer HAL 9000.
awards: Won 1 Academy Award

title: Get Out
movie_plot: A young black man uncovers a disturbing secret when he meets the family of his white girlfriend.
awards: Won the Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay

title: Mad Max: Fury Road
writer: George Miller, Brendan McCarthy, Nico Lathouris
movie_plot: In a post-apocalyptic wasteland, a drifter named Max teams up with a mysterious woman to escape from a tyrannical ruler.
awards: Won 6 Academy Awards

title: No Country for Old Men
movie_plot: A hunter stumbles across a drug deal gone wrong, takes the money, and is hunted by a psychopathic killer.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: The Thing
movie_plot: A research team in Antarctica is terrorized by an alien shape-shifter that assimilates and imitates its victims.
awards: Nominated for Best Horror Film at the Saturn Awards

title: A Clockwork Orange
movie_plot: In a futuristic Britain, a gang leader is imprisoned and volunteers for an experimental rehabilitation program.
awards: Nominated for 4 Academy Awards

title: Train to Busan
movie_plot: A father and his daughter are trapped on a train during a zombie apocalypse in South Korea.
awards: Won Best Director at the Fantasia International Film Festival

title: Blade Runner
movie_plot: A cop hunts down four genetically engineered beings who have returned to earth to find their creator.
awards: Nominated for 2 Academy Awards

title: The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari
movie_plot: A hypnotist uses a sleepwalker to commit murders and terrorize a German mountain town.
awards: Critically acclaimed classic, no major awards

title: Mad Max
movie_plot: In a post-apocalyptic future, a police officer sets out to avenge the death of his family.
awards: Won AACTA Award for Best Film

title: Dracula
movie_plot: The ancient vampire Count Dracula travels to London to find new victims to prey on.
awards: Critically acclaimed classic, no major awards

title: The Exorcist
movie_plot: A mother seeks the help of two priests to save her young daughter from a demonic possession that has taken hold of her.
awards: Won 2 Academy Awards

title: The Sixth Sense
movie_plot: A child psychologist tries to help a young boy who can communicate with spirits.
awards: Nominated for 6 Academy Awards

title: Get Carter
movie_plot: A London gangster returns to his hometown of Newcastle to investigate his brother's suspicious death.
awards: Considered a cult classic

title: City of God
movie_plot: In the Cidade de Deus favela of Rio de Janeiro, two young men follow different paths: one becomes a photographer and documents the escalating violence, while the other becomes a notorious drug dealer.
awards: Nominated for 4 Academy Awards

title: Inglourious Basterds
movie_plot: In Nazi-occupied France, a group of Jewish-American soldiers known as 'The Basterds' are tasked with instilling fear in the Third Reich. Their paths cross with a young Jewish woman running a cinema, who has a plan of her own for revenge.
awards: Won Oscar for Best Supporting Actor

title: Whiplash
movie_plot: A young jazz drummer enrolls at a prestigious music academy, where he is pushed to his limits by an abusive instructor.
awards: Won 3 Academy Awards

title: La La Land
movie_plot: A jazz pianist and an aspiring actress fall in love while navigating their careers in Los Angeles.
awards: Won 6 Academy Awards

title: Django Unchained
movie_plot: A freed slave travels across the United States with a German bounty hunter to rescue his wife from a cruel plantation owner.
awards: Won 2 Academy Awards

title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
movie_plot: A former assassin, waking up from a four-year coma, seeks revenge on her former teammates who tried to kill her.
awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe

title: The Hateful Eight
movie_plot: In post-Civil War Wyoming, a bounty hunter and his fugitive get caught in a blizzard and must seek shelter at a stagecoach stop with a group of shady strangers.
awards: Won the Academy Award for Best Original Score

title: Mad Max 2: The Road Warrior
movie_plot: In a post-apocalyptic future, a drifter protects a small, oil-rich community from a gang of bandits.
awards: Nominated for Best Sci-Fi Film at the Saturn Awards

title: The Shining
movie_plot: A family spends a winter in an isolated hotel, where a sinister presence influences the father's descent into madness.
awards: Nominated for Worst Director at the Golden Raspberry Awards

title: Dr. Strangelove
writer: Stanley Kubrick, Terry Southern, Peter George
movie_plot: A deranged U.S. Air Force general orders a pre-emptive nuclear strike on the Soviet Union. The President, his advisors, and a former Nazi scientist must try to stop the impending Armageddon.
awards: Nominated for 4 Academy Awards

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
writer: J.R.R. Tolkien, Fran Walsh, Philippa Boyens
movie: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
movie_plot: While Frodo and Sam continue their journey to Mordor, the remaining members of the fellowship join forces with new allies to fight against the forces of Saruman and Sauron.
awards: Won 2 Academy Awards

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
writer: J.R.R. Tolkien, Fran Walsh, Philippa Boyens
movie: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
movie_plot: The final battle for Middle-earth begins, as Frodo and Sam race against time to destroy the One Ring.
awards: Won 11 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: The Shawshank Redemption
movie_plot: A successful banker is wrongly convicted of murdering his wife and her lover. He is sent to a brutal prison, where he maintains his hope and earns the respect of his fellow inmates, including a man named 'Red.'
awards: Nominated for 7 Academy Awards

title: Forrest Gump
movie_plot: A man with a low IQ recounts his life story, which includes key moments from American history.
awards: Won 6 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: The Green Mile
movie_plot: A death row prison guard discovers that a black inmate with a supernatural gift has been falsely convicted of a crime he did not commit.
awards: Nominated for 4 Academy Awards

title: Schindler's List
movie_plot: The true story of a German industrialist who saved over a thousand Jewish refugees from the Holocaust.
awards: Won 7 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: The Pianist
movie_plot: A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive in the Warsaw Ghetto during World War II.
awards: Won 3 Academy Awards

title: Fight Club
movie_plot: An insomniac office worker and a soap maker form an underground fight club that evolves into something much, much more.
awards: Nominated for 1 Academy Award

title: The Departed
movie_plot: In Boston, a state trooper goes undercover to infiltrate a powerful Irish gang, while a mole from the gang rises through the ranks of the police force. Both sides race to discover the other's identity.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: Goodfellas
movie_plot: The rise and fall of mobster Henry Hill as he and his friends navigate the world of organized crime.
awards: Won 1 Academy Award

title: Saving Private Ryan
movie_plot: A group of U.S. soldiers is sent behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose three brothers have already been killed in action.
awards: Won 5 Academy Awards

title: Léon: The Professional
movie_plot: A young girl is taken in by a professional hitman after her family is murdered, and she becomes his protegé.
awards: Nominated for 7 Césars

title: Jaws
movie_plot: A police chief, a marine biologist, and a grizzled shark hunter team up to kill a man-eating great white shark that is terrorizing a coastal town.
awards: Won 3 Academy Awards

title: The Texas Chain Saw Massacre
movie_plot: Five friends on a road trip fall victim to a family of cannibals in rural Texas.
awards: Considered a cult classic

title: The Terminator
movie_plot: A cyborg assassin is sent back in time from the year 2029 to kill a woman whose unborn son will one day save humanity from a robotic apocalypse.
awards: Considered a classic, no major awards

title: Back to the Future
movie_plot: A high school student is accidentally sent 30 years into the past in a time-traveling DeLorean.
awards: Won 1 Academy Award

title: The Dark Knight Rises
movie_plot: Batman must return to save Gotham City from a brutal new terrorist leader, Bane.
awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA

title: All the President's Men
movie_plot: Two Washington Post reporters, Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein, investigate the 1972 Watergate scandal that eventually led to President Richard Nixon's resignation.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards

title: The Princess Bride
movie_plot: A charming and fantastical fairytale, told in a story within a story, follows a farmhand named Westley who must rescue his true love, Princess Buttercup, from a villainous prince.
awards: Nominated for Oscar for Best Original Song

title: When Harry Met Sally...
movie_plot: Harry and Sally, friends who first meet on a cross-country drive, grapple with the question of whether a man and a woman can be strictly platonic friends.
awards: Nominated for Oscar for Best Original Screenplay

title: Singin' in the Rain
movie_plot: A silent film star falls for a chorus girl, but his career is threatened by the advent of 'talkies.' The film playfully spoofs the tumultuous transition of Hollywood from silent to sound films.
awards: Nominated for 2 Academy Awards
Inducted into the National Film Registry

title: Y tu mamá también
production_house: Fondo de Fomento a la Calidad Cinematográfica
movie_plot: Two teenage friends embark on a road trip across Mexico with an older, attractive woman, leading to a journey of self-discovery and the complexities of friendship and sexuality.
awards: Nominated for Oscar for Best Original Screenplay

title: Amores Perros
movie_plot: Three intertwined stories, each connected by a car crash, explore the harsh realities of life in Mexico City and the relationships between humans and their dogs.
awards: Nominated for Oscar for Best Foreign Language Film

title: The Big Lebowski
movie_plot: A Los Angeles slacker known as 'The Dude' is mistaken for a millionaire with the same name. He seeks restitution for his ruined rug, leading him and his bowling buddies into a bizarre kidnapping plot.
awards: No major awards, but a cult classic

title: La Terra Trema
movie_plot: In a small Sicilian fishing village, a young man, enraged by the exploitation of local wholesalers, decides to mortgage his family home to start his own business. The film follows his struggle and the eventual downfall of his family.
awards: Venice Film Festival International Award

title: Ghostbusters
movie_plot: Three parapsychologists, kicked out of their university, start a ghost-catching business in New York City. They soon discover a portal to another dimension, unleashing ghosts upon the city.
awards: Nominated for 2 Academy Awards

title: Working Girl
movie_plot: An ambitious but timid secretary from Staten Island takes her conniving boss's job after the boss is sidelined by a broken leg. She must navigate a high-stakes business deal to prove her worth.
awards: Won Oscar for Best Original Song

title: The Manchurian Candidate
movie_plot: A U.S. Army veteran is brainwashed by communists during the Korean War and is unwittingly turned into a political assassin. A former comrade struggles to uncover the plot before it's too late.
awards: Nominated for 2 Academy Awards

title: Die Hard
writer: Jeb Stuart, Steven E. de Souza
movie_plot: New York City cop John McClane travels to Los Angeles to spend Christmas with his estranged wife. Their holiday is interrupted when terrorists seize control of the building where his wife works.
awards: Nominated for 4 Academy Awards

title: Splash
movie_plot: A man falls in love with a beautiful mermaid who has been searching for him since he was a child. She comes to New York City and must learn to live on land before her identity is revealed.
awards: Nominated for Oscar for Best Original Screenplay

title: The Secret in Their Eyes
movie_plot: A retired legal counselor writes a novel about an unresolved rape and murder case from his past, prompting him to revisit the details and his long-lost love interest, a judge who worked on the case.
awards: Won Oscar for Best Foreign Language Film

title: Big
movie_plot: A 12-year-old boy wishes to be 'big' at a carnival machine and wakes up as an adult. He must navigate the complexities of grown-up life, including a job at a toy company and a romance with a co-worker.
awards: Nominated for 2 Academy Awards

title: The Last Emperor
movie_plot: The film chronicles the life of Pu Yi, the last emperor of China, from his birth and ascension to the throne to his imprisonment and eventual release during the Communist regime.
awards: Won 9 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: Elf
movie_plot: A human, raised as an elf at the North Pole, travels to New York City to find his biological father and spread Christmas cheer in a world that has lost its holiday spirit.
awards: No major awards, but a modern Christmas classic

title: Do the Right Thing
movie_plot: On the hottest day of the summer, racial tensions in a Brooklyn neighborhood, particularly between the black residents and the Italian-American owners of a pizzeria, escalate to a tragic conclusion.
awards: Nominated for 2 Academy Awards

title: Good Will Hunting
movie_plot: A young man with a genius-level intellect, working as a janitor at MIT, is forced to re-evaluate his life and confront his inner demons with the help of a psychologist.
awards: Won 2 Academy Awards

title: The Goonies
movie_plot: A group of young misfits, facing the loss of their homes, discover an old map that leads to the treasure of a legendary pirate. They embark on a perilous adventure to save their neighborhood.
awards: No major awards, but a cult classic

title: There Will Be Blood
movie_plot: A turn-of-the-century oil prospector ruthlessly builds an empire, sacrificing his family, morals, and sanity along the way. His ambition is met with conflict from a local preacher.
awards: Won 2 Academy Awards

title: Z
movie_plot: A prosecutor and a journalist investigate the death of a prominent pacifist politician, who was killed in a hit-and-run accident, and uncover a vast government conspiracy to cover up the assassination.
awards: Won 2 Academy Awards

title: The Elephant Man
writer: Christopher De Vore, Eric Bergren, David Lynch
movie_plot: A Victorian surgeon discovers a severely deformed man, John Merrick, in a freak show. He takes him to a hospital, where he finds that underneath the physical deformities lies a gentle and intelligent soul.
awards: Nominated for 8 Academy Awards

title: A Christmas Story
writer: Jean Shepherd, Leigh Brown, Bob Clark
movie_plot: In the 1940s, a young boy named Ralphie attempts to convince his parents, his teacher, and Santa Claus that a Red Ryder B.B. gun is the perfect Christmas gift.
awards: No major awards, but a holiday classic

title: The Third Man
movie_plot: A naive American pulp novelist travels to post-war Vienna to meet his old friend, but is shocked to learn that his friend was killed in a traffic accident. His investigation into the death uncovers a dark conspiracy.
awards: Won Oscar for Best Cinematography

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
movie_plot: Based on a true story, a young stockbroker rises to fame and fortune by defrauding wealthy investors. He leads a life of excess and depravity, attracting the attention of the FBI.
awards: Nominated for 5 Academy Awards

title: Children of Men
writer: Alfonso Cuarón, Timothy J. Sexton, David Arata
movie_plot: In a future where the human race has become infertile, a former activist must transport a pregnant woman to a sanctuary at sea, where scientists are working to find a cure for infertility.
awards: Nominated for 3 Academy Awards

title: Say Anything...
movie_plot: An underachieving slacker, with no clear plans for his future, falls in love with a brilliant, popular girl who has a scholarship to a prestigious university. He struggles to prove his worth and win her heart.
awards: No major awards, but a cult classic

title: The General
movie_plot: During the American Civil War, a train engineer, who is denied enlistment, must single-handedly pursue Union spies who have stolen his train and kidnapped his love interest.
awards: Inducted into the National Film Registry

title: The Truman Show
movie_plot: A cheerful man lives his entire life on a television show, unaware that his reality is a meticulously constructed set and that everyone he knows is an actor.
awards: Nominated for 3 Academy Awards

title: Rushmore
movie_plot: A eccentric and ambitious high school student, who is more interested in his extracurricular activities than his grades, falls for a much older teacher and finds a rival in a disillusioned millionaire.
awards: No major awards, but a cult classic

title: Being John Malkovich
movie_plot: A puppeteer discovers a small, hidden portal in his office that leads directly into the mind of the famous actor John Malkovich. He begins to sell tickets to the experience, leading to chaos and a love triangle.
awards: Nominated for 3 Academy Awards

title: The Silence
movie_plot: A young blind boy, who tunes musical instruments for a living, lives with his mother. When the family faces the threat of eviction, he must use his exceptional sense of hearing to earn money, but his love of music often distracts him.
awards: No major awards, but critically acclaimed

title: Die Welle (The Wave)
movie_plot: A high school teacher, as part of a class project on autocracy, conducts an experiment to demonstrate how easily people can be manipulated. His experiment spirals out of control, as students begin to adopt the fascist-like movement.
awards: German Film Award for Best Film

title: A Beautiful Mind
movie_plot: A brilliant but eccentric mathematician, John Nash, accepts a top-secret assignment with the government. His life, filled with secrets and paranoia, is thrown into chaos as he struggles with his inner demons.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: The Sound of Music
movie_plot: A young postulant is sent to a family of seven unruly children to serve as their governess. Her love of music and zest for life transform the strict household and capture the heart of their stern, widowed father.
awards: Won 5 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: Il bidone (The Swindlers)
writer: Federico Fellini, Ennio Flaiano, Tullio Pinelli
movie_plot: A group of con artists, disguised as priests and officials, swindle poor villagers. One of them, a man named Augusto, feels a deep sense of remorse and seeks to reconnect with his family, but finds it difficult to change his ways.
awards: No major awards, but a transitional film for Fellini

title: The Apartment
writer: Billy Wilder, I. A. L. Diamond
movie_plot: An insurance clerk tries to climb the corporate ladder by allowing his senior executives to use his apartment for their extramarital affairs. He is forced to confront his choices when he falls for a woman who is involved with his boss.
awards: Won 5 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: The Hunt
movie_plot: A kindergarten teacher is wrongly accused of child abuse. The accusation spreads like wildfire, turning his entire community against him and destroying his life.
awards: Nominated for Oscar for Best Foreign Language Film

title: The Florida Project
movie_plot: The film follows the summer adventures of a vibrant 6-year-old girl, Moonee, and her friends living in a motel near Walt Disney World. They make the most of their lives, while the adults around them struggle to make ends meet.
awards: Nominated for Oscar for Best Supporting Actor

title: The Lighthouse
movie_plot: Two lighthouse keepers on a remote, mysterious island off the coast of New England slowly descend into madness as a storm threatens to engulf them, and a terrifying supernatural presence looms.
awards: Nominated for Oscar for Best Cinematography

title: Ladri di biciclette (Bicycle Thieves)
movie_plot: In post-WWII Rome, a poor father's newly acquired job, which requires a bicycle, is put in jeopardy when his bicycle is stolen. He and his young son set out on a desperate search for the bike through the city's crowded streets.
awards: Academy Honorary Award

title: Il conformista (The Conformist)
movie_plot: A weak-willed man, haunted by a childhood trauma, attempts to fit in by joining the fascist secret police in 1930s Italy. He is assigned to assassinate his former professor, a political dissident.
awards: Nominated for Oscar for Best Adapted Screenplay

title: Lost in Translation
movie_plot: An aging movie star and a lonely young woman form an unlikely friendship in Tokyo. They bond over their shared sense of alienation and culture shock, leading to a profound connection.
awards: Won Oscar for Best Original Screenplay

title: I Saw the Devil
movie_plot: A secret agent embarks on a gruesome quest for revenge against a psychopathic serial killer who murdered his fiancée. The hunt turns into a cat-and-mouse game, blurring the lines between good and evil.
awards: Won Best Director at the 2011 Fantasporto International Film Festival

title: The Wailing
movie_plot: A small village is plagued by a mysterious illness after the arrival of a stranger. A local police officer finds himself embroiled in a horrifying investigation that forces him to question his sanity and faith.
awards: Won Best Film at the 37th Blue Dragon Film Awards

title: Memories of Murder
movie_plot: In 1986, two bumbling provincial detectives struggle with the case of a serial rapist and killer in a small town. Their investigation is hampered by their own incompetence and the lack of forensic technology.
awards: Won Best Film and Best Director at the 2003 Grand Bell Awards

title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
writer: Wang Hui-ling, James Schamus, Tsai Kuo-jung
movie_plot: A young woman in 19th-century China is in love with her father's servant, but her fate forces her to marry another man. She finds freedom in the world of martial arts, where she encounters a legendary sword.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards, including Best Foreign Language Film

title: Hero
writer: Zhang Yimou, Feng Li, Wang Bin
movie_plot: A nameless swordsman, who has defeated the three most feared assassins in the land, is granted an audience with the king. He recounts his epic tale, but the truth of his mission may not be what it seems.
awards: Nominated for an Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film

title: House of Flying Daggers
writer: Zhang Yimou, Wang Bin, Li Feng
movie_plot: In 9th-century China, a Tang Dynasty police officer arrests a blind dancer who may be the daughter of the leader of a revolutionary group. He becomes entangled in a dangerous love triangle and a web of deceit.
awards: Nominated for an Academy Award for Best Cinematography

title: Ip Man
movie_plot: The biographical story of Ip Man, the legendary grandmaster of Wing Chun and the first to teach the martial art publicly. The film follows his life during the Sino-Japanese War and his fight for dignity.
awards: Won Best Film at the 28th Hong Kong Film Awards

title: Thappad
movie_plot: A woman's seemingly perfect life is shattered when her husband slaps her at a party. She decides to file for divorce, challenging the societal notion that a slap is a minor incident in a marriage.
awards: Won Best Film at the 66th Filmfare Awards

title: Swades
movie_plot: A successful Indian-American scientist working at NASA returns to his native village to find his nanny. His journey reconnects him with his roots and makes him realize his responsibility towards his country.
awards: Won Best Actor (Shah Rukh Khan) at the 50th Filmfare Awards

title: Kaminey
writer: Vishal Bhardwaj, Abhishek Chaubey, Sabrina Dhawan
movie_plot: Estranged twin brothers, one with a lisp and the other with a stutter, are thrown into a cat-and-mouse chase when they become embroiled in a world of drugs, politics, and crime.
awards: Won Best Film (Critics) at the 55th Filmfare Awards

title: Andhadhun
writer: Sriram Raghavan, Arijit Biswas, Pooja Ladha Surti
movie_plot: A seemingly blind pianist's life takes a horrifying turn when he witnesses the murder of a former film actor. He is forced to keep up the charade of being blind to survive, leading to a series of comedic and terrifying events.
awards: Won 3 National Film Awards, including Best Feature Film in Hindi

title: Newton
movie_plot: A government clerk is sent to a remote, conflict-ridden jungle of Chhattisgarh to conduct elections. He is determined to hold a fair election despite the apathy of security forces and the threat of Naxalite insurgents.
awards: Won National Film Award for Best Feature Film in Hindi

title: Rashomon
movie_plot: A masterfully constructed crime story told from four different, conflicting perspectives—a bandit, a samurai's wife, a woodcutter, and the samurai's spirit—leaving the viewer to question the very nature of truth.
awards: Won an Honorary Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film

title: Tokyo Story
movie_plot: An aging couple travels to Tokyo to visit their grown children, but are disappointed by their children's indifference and preoccupation with their own lives. The film is a poignant meditation on family and aging.
awards: Frequently ranked as one of the greatest films of all time

title: Harakiri
movie_plot: A masterless samurai arrives at a feudal lord's home, requesting a ritual suicide in the courtyard. The film unfolds in a series of flashbacks, revealing his true motives and a story of honor and betrayal.
awards: Won the Jury Special Prize at the 1963 Cannes Film Festival

title: Ran
writer: Akira Kurosawa, Hideo Oguni, Masato Ide
movie_plot: A Japanese warlord, inspired by Shakespeare's King Lear, decides to abdicate his throne and divide his kingdom among his three sons. His decision unleashes a bloody civil war, plunging his family into chaos.
awards: Won an Academy Award for Best Costume Design

title: A Wednesday!
movie_plot: A retiring police officer reminisces about a seemingly insignificant day in his career when a single, anonymous man held the city of Mumbai hostage, challenging the law and order to get justice.
awards: Won Best Debut Director at the 54th Filmfare Awards

title: Dangal
writer: Nitesh Tiwari, Piyush Gupta, Shreyas Jain
movie_plot: Based on a true story, a former wrestler dreams of winning a gold medal for his country. When his dream is left unfulfilled, he trains his two daughters to become world-class wrestlers.
awards: Won 4 National Film Awards, including Best Film on Other Social Issues

title: Rang De Basanti
movie_plot: An English documentary filmmaker arrives in India to film a documentary on five freedom fighters. She recruits five friends, who, while acting in the film, begin to question the state of their country.
awards: Won the National Film Award for Best Popular Film

title: Gangs of Wasseypur
writer: Zeishan Quadri, Akhilesh Jaiswal, Anurag Kashyap
movie_plot: The film chronicles a bloody, decades-long feud between two rival crime families, the Khans and the Qureshis, in the coal-mining town of Wasseypur, India.
awards: Nominated for Best Film at the Asia Pacific Screen Awards

title: The Grandmaster
writer: Zou Jingzhi, Xu Haofeng, Wong Kar-wai
movie_plot: A biographical film about the life of Ip Man, the legendary Wing Chun grandmaster. The film follows his life from the 1930s until his final days in Hong Kong, detailing his love story and the political turmoil of the time.
awards: Won Best Cinematography and Best Art Direction at the 86th Academy Awards

title: A Taxi Driver
movie_plot: Based on a true story, a Gwangju taxi driver helps a German journalist cover the 1980 Gwangju Uprising. The film captures the courage of ordinary citizens in the face of government oppression.
awards: Won Best Film at the 38th Blue Dragon Film Awards

title: The Chaser
movie_plot: A disgraced ex-cop turned pimp is in debt and desperate to find his missing call girls. His investigation leads him to a serial killer who has been targeting his employees, forcing him into a terrifying race against time.
awards: Won Best Film at the 29th Blue Dragon Film Awards

title: The Man from Nowhere
movie_plot: A mysterious and reclusive pawnshop owner with a dark past embarks on a violent rampage to save a young girl, his only friend, who has been kidnapped by a drug trafficking ring.
awards: Won Best Actor (Won Bin) at the 47th Grand Bell Awards

title: Burning
movie_plot: A young man finds himself in a strange love triangle with a former high-school classmate and a wealthy, enigmatic man. His suspicions grow as his classmate vanishes, and he begins to investigate the man's secret hobby.
awards: Nominated for the Palme d'Or at the 2018 Cannes Film Festival

title: The Host
writer: Bong Joon-ho, Baek Chul-hyun, Ha Joon-won
movie_plot: A clumsy but devoted father and his family must save his daughter from a giant mutant creature that emerges from Seoul's Han River, caused by an American military pathologist dumping chemicals into the water.
awards: Won Best Film at the 2007 Asian Film Awards

title: Bhaag Milkha Bhaag
movie_plot: The biographical story of Milkha Singh, a former Indian track and field athlete who was a national champion runner and an Olympian. The film details his struggles and triumphs, earning him the title 'The Flying Sikh'.
awards: Won 2 National Film Awards, including Best Popular Film Providing Wholesome Entertainment

title: Lagaan: Once Upon a Time in India
writer: Ashutosh Gowariker, Kumar Dave, Sanjay Daima
movie: Lagaan: Once Upon a Time in India
movie_plot: In a small Indian village during the British Raj, a farmer challenges a tyrannical British officer to a game of cricket to avoid paying a heavy tax. If they win, their taxes will be waived for three years.
awards: Nominated for an Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film

title: Black
writer: Sanjay Leela Bhansali, Bhavani Iyer, Prakash Kapadia
movie_plot: A story of a blind, deaf, and mute girl, and her teacher who battles to bring her into the light of life by helping her communicate. It is inspired by the life of Helen Keller and Anne Sullivan.
awards: Won 3 National Film Awards, including Best Feature Film in Hindi

title: Visaranai
movie_plot: Based on a true story, four laborers are arrested by police and brutally tortured to confess to a crime they did not commit. They must find a way to escape this systemic injustice and survive.
awards: Won 3 National Film Awards, including Best Feature Film in Tamil

title: Vada Chennai
movie_plot: A gifted carrom player gets drawn into the world of crime and politics in North Chennai. He becomes entangled in a power struggle between two rival gangs, forcing him to choose a side.
awards: Won Best Actor (Dhanush) at the 66th National Film Awards

title: Baahubali: The Beginning
movie_plot: A young man with superhuman strength is raised by a tribe. His quest to find his purpose leads him to an ancient kingdom and a complex family history that reveals his true identity as a prince.
awards: Won National Film Award for Best Feature Film

title: Kumbalangi Nights
movie_plot: Four eccentric brothers, living in a dilapidated house in the coastal village of Kumbalangi, learn to overcome their differences and become a family after a new person enters their lives.
awards: Won Best Film with a Message at the IFFI

title: The Yellow Sea
movie_plot: An ethnic Korean man in China is sent to South Korea on a mission to assassinate a man. He finds himself embroiled in a bloody chase when he is framed for the murder he did not commit.
awards: Won Best Director at the 2011 Asian Film Awards

title: Peepli Live
movie_plot: A poor farmer threatens to commit suicide to receive government compensation. His decision becomes a media circus, with news channels and politicians fighting to cover his story.
awards: Won Best First Film of a Director at the 58th National Film Awards

title: My Sassy Girl
movie_plot: A timid engineering student's life changes when he encounters a drunk and sassy young woman at a subway station. Their relationship blossoms through a series of misadventures and funny incidents.
awards: Voted Best Asian Film at the 2003 Udine Far East Film Festival

title: The Handmaiden
movie_plot: In 1930s Korea, a young woman is hired as a handmaiden to a Japanese heiress, but secretly conspires with a con man to defraud her. The plot thickens with betrayal, lies, and unexpected desires.
awards: Won the Vulcan Award at the 2016 Cannes Film Festival

title: The Good, the Bad, the Weird
movie: The Good, the Bad, the Weird
movie_plot: In 1930s Manchuria, a train robbery sets off a chaotic chase between three characters: a bounty hunter, a bandit, and a hitman. All three are after a hidden treasure map.
awards: Won Best Director at the 2008 Sitges Film Festival

title: Mahanati
movie_plot: A biographical film based on the life of Savitri, a legendary actress from South India. The film explores her rise to stardom and her tragic personal life, including her struggles with addiction.
awards: Won 3 National Film Awards, including Best Actress (Keerthy Suresh)

title: Baahubali 2: The Conclusion
movie_plot: Following the events of the first film, this sequel continues the epic saga of Baahubali and his fight to reclaim his throne. The film reveals the answer to the famous question: 'Why did Katappa kill Baahubali?'
awards: Won 3 National Film Awards, including Best Popular Film Providing Wholesome Entertainment

title: RRR
movie_plot: A fictional story about two legendary Indian revolutionaries, Alluri Sitarama Raju and Komaram Bheem, and their friendship and fight against the British Raj.
awards: Won the Golden Globe for Best Original Song

title: The Battle of Algiers
movie_plot: A recreation of the events leading up to Algeria's war of independence against the French. The film focuses on the revolutionary fighters and the French paratroopers who try to stop them.
awards: Won the Golden Lion at the 1966 Venice Film Festival

title: Grave of the Fireflies
movie_plot: In the final months of World War II, a teenage boy and his young sister struggle to survive in the Japanese countryside after their mother is killed in an American bombing raid.
awards: Won Best Animation Film at the 1989 Blue Ribbon Awards

title: Akira
movie_plot: In Neo-Tokyo, a biker gang leader's life is thrown into chaos when his childhood friend awakens powerful telekinetic abilities. He must race against a clandestine government project to save his friend from himself.
awards: Widely considered one of the greatest animated and science fiction films ever made

title: Godzilla
movie_plot: A prehistoric sea creature, awakened by nuclear bomb testing, terrorizes Japan as it wreaks havoc on Tokyo. A group of scientists must find a way to stop the monster before it destroys the country.
awards: Won the Japan Film Professional Award for Best Film

title: Yojimbo
movie_plot: A masterless samurai arrives in a small town divided by two warring gangs. He offers his services as a bodyguard to both sides, secretly manipulating them against each other for his own gain.
awards: Won Best Actor (Toshiro Mifune) at the 22nd Venice Film Festival

title: Ikiru
writer: Akira Kurosawa, Shinobu Hashimoto, Hideo Oguni
movie_plot: A dying man, a middle-aged bureaucrat, decides to find meaning in his life after learning he has cancer. He embarks on a quest to make a difference and build a small playground for children.
awards: Won the Golden Bear at the 1952 Berlin International Film Festival

title: Kantara
movie_plot: A demigod, who protects a tribal village and its forest, disappears. The film follows a human protector who takes on the responsibility, leading him to a conflict with the local authorities.
awards: Nominated for Best Film at the 2023 Filmfare Awards South

title: Ponniyin Selvan: I
writer: Mani Ratnam, Elango Kumaravel, B. Jeyamohan
movie_plot: Based on a Tamil novel, the film chronicles the early days of the Chola prince Arulmozhi Varman, who would later become the great king Rajaraja I. It explores the political intrigues and conspiracies of the era.
awards: Won Best Film at the 68th Filmfare Awards South

title: Leo
writer: Lokesh Kanagaraj, Rathna Kumar, Deeraj Vaidy
movie_plot: A cafe owner and a former gangster living a peaceful life in Himachal Pradesh, must defend his family from a drug cartel that is hunting him down for his past sins.
awards: Highest grossing Tamil film of 2023

title: The First Slam Dunk
movie_plot: The story follows Ryota Miyagi, the point guard of the Shohoku High School basketball team. The film chronicles his journey and the team's relentless quest to win the national basketball championship.
awards: Won the Japan Academy Film Prize for Animation of the Year

title: The Night Comes for Us
movie_plot: A former elite gang enforcer betrays his crime family to save a young girl. He finds himself hunted by his former allies and must fight his way out of the city to protect her.
awards: Nominated for Best Film at the 2019 Fantasia International Film Festival

title: The Raid: Redemption
movie_plot: A rookie S.W.A.T. team is sent on a mission to storm a high-rise apartment building controlled by a ruthless drug lord. They must fight their way through hordes of gangsters to complete their mission.
awards: Won the Midnight Madness People's Choice Award at the 2011 Toronto International Film Festival

title: The Road
movie_plot: In a post-apocalyptic world, a father and his son journey across a desolate landscape to reach the coast. They face the constant threat of cannibalistic gangs and the struggle to survive.
awards: Nominated for a BAFTA Award for Best Cinematography

title: The King's Speech
movie_plot: The story of King George VI of the United Kingdom, who, with the help of a speech therapist, overcomes his stammer to deliver an important radio broadcast before the start of World War II.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: A Fantastic Woman
movie_plot: A transgender woman faces discrimination and scrutiny after her much older partner suddenly dies. She must fight for her right to grieve and exist in a society that doesn't accept her.
awards: Won the Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film

title: Jojo Rabbit
movie_plot: A lonely German boy in World War II, who is a member of the Hitler Youth, discovers that his mother is hiding a young Jewish girl in their home. His imaginary friend, a whimsical version of Hitler, guides him through his moral dilemma.
awards: Won the Academy Award for Best Adapted Screenplay

title: The Shape of Water
movie_plot: A mute cleaning lady at a secret government laboratory falls in love with an amphibious creature being held captive. She embarks on a plan to rescue the creature with the help of her friends.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: Moonlight
movie_plot: A three-part story that follows a young African-American man named Chiron through three defining chapters of his life. The film explores his struggles with his identity and sexuality.
awards: Won 3 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: Arrival
movie_plot: When mysterious alien spacecrafts land on Earth, a linguistics expert is recruited by the military to communicate with the extraterrestrials. Her work becomes a race against time to prevent a global war.
awards: Won an Academy Award for Best Sound Editing

title: Dune: Part Two
writer: Denis Villeneuve, Jon Spaihts, Frank Herbert
movie_plot: Paul Atreides unites with Chani and the Fremen to wage war against House Harkonnen, who destroyed his family. He must choose between the love of his life and the fate of the universe.
awards: Highest-grossing film of 2024

title: Bohemian Rhapsody
movie_plot: A celebration of the legendary rock band Queen and their lead singer Freddie Mercury. The film follows Mercury's rise to fame, his personal struggles, and his final iconic performance at Live Aid.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards, including Best Actor (Rami Malek)

title: Walk the Line
movie_plot: A biographical film about the life of country music icon Johnny Cash. The film explores his early life, his rise to fame, his struggles with addiction, and his love story with June Carter.
awards: Won the Academy Award for Best Actress (Reese Witherspoon)

title: Ray
movie_plot: The biographical story of the legendary musician Ray Charles. The film follows his journey from a blind and poor boy to an international superstar, and his struggles with addiction and personal demons.
awards: Won the Academy Award for Best Actor (Jamie Foxx)

title: Elvis
writer: Baz Luhrmann, Sam Bromell, Craig Pearce
movie_plot: The life of rock-and-roll icon Elvis Presley is seen through the eyes of his enigmatic manager, Colonel Tom Parker. The film explores their complex relationship and the rise of Presley's stardom.
awards: Nominated for 8 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: Rocketman
movie_plot: A musical fantasy about the extraordinary life of Elton John, from his early years as a shy prodigy to his legendary rise to fame. The film is a magical journey through his most iconic songs.
awards: Won the Academy Award for Best Original Song

title: Poor Things
movie_plot: A young woman who has been reanimated by an eccentric scientist embarks on a fantastic and surreal journey of self-discovery, escaping the confines of her Victorian world.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards, including Best Actress (Emma Stone)

title: Anatomy of a Fall
movie_plot: A woman is the prime suspect in the death of her husband, who fell from their chalet. Their blind son's testimony becomes crucial as the trial delves into the complexities of their marriage.
awards: Won the Palme d'Or at the 2023 Cannes Film Festival

title: Oppenheimer
movie_plot: The biographical story of J. Robert Oppenheimer, the theoretical physicist who led the Manhattan Project and developed the first nuclear weapons. The film explores the moral and ethical dilemmas he faced.
awards: Won 7 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: The Banshees of Inisherin
movie_plot: Two lifelong friends on a remote Irish island find themselves at an impasse when one of them abruptly ends their friendship. The film explores the absurd and tragic consequences of their feud.
awards: Nominated for 9 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: Anora
movie_plot: A New York stripper's life changes when she meets and impulsively marries the son of a Russian oligarch. Their marriage becomes a whirlwind of chaotic events as his parents try to annul their union.
awards: Won the Palme d'Or at the 2024 Cannes Film Festival

title: Gladiator II
movie_plot: The sequel to the 2000 epic film follows Lucius, the nephew of Commodus, and his journey through the political intrigues of Rome. He finds himself in the gladiatorial arena, seeking justice and revenge.
awards: Highly anticipated blockbuster of 2024

title: A Complete Unknown
movie_plot: The biographical story of Bob Dylan, the legendary folk musician. The film chronicles his rise to fame and his controversial decision to go electric at the Newport Folk Festival in 1965.
awards: Premiered at the 2024 Telluride Film Festival

title: The Substance
movie_plot: A woman uses a revolutionary new substance that creates a more beautiful, perfect version of herself. But when the two versions of herself must share time, a violent and terrifying conflict ensues.
awards: Won Best Screenplay at the 2024 Cannes Film Festival

title: Thelma
movie_plot: A 93-year-old woman is scammed by a fraudster pretending to be her grandson. She embarks on a 'Mission: Impossible'-style quest to retrieve her money and get revenge.
awards: Nominated for the Grand Jury Prize at the 2024 Sundance Film Festival

title: Blade Runner 2049
movie_plot: A new 'Blade Runner,' LAPD Officer K, unearths a long-buried secret that has the potential to plunge what’s left of society into chaos. His discovery leads him on a quest to find Rick Deckard, a former Blade Runner who has been missing for 30 years.
awards: Won 2 Academy Awards, including Best Cinematography

title: Nomadland
movie_plot: A woman in her sixties, who lost everything in the Great Recession, embarks on a journey through the American West, living as a modern-day nomad in a van. She finds a new sense of purpose and community.
awards: Won 3 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: The Power of the Dog
country: UK, USA, Australia, New Zealand, Canada
movie_plot: A charismatic but menacing rancher intimidates his brother's new wife and her son. The family drama unfolds on a beautiful but tense Montana ranch, revealing secrets and a complex web of relationships.
awards: Won the Academy Award for Best Director

title: CODA
movie_plot: A young girl, the only hearing member of her deaf family, struggles to balance her passion for singing with her family's dependence on her. The film is a heartfelt story about family and finding your voice.
awards: Won 3 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: Manchester by the Sea
movie_plot: A reclusive handyman is forced to return to his hometown to care for his teenage nephew after his brother's death. He must confront his traumatic past and the people he left behind.
awards: Won 2 Academy Awards, including Best Original Screenplay and Best Actor (Casey Affleck)

title: Hereditary
movie_plot: After the death of their secretive grandmother, a family is haunted by a malevolent presence. They are forced to uncover terrifying family secrets and battle an ancient, demonic force.
awards: Won Best Actress (Toni Collette) at the 2018 Gotham Awards

title: Midsommar
movie_plot: A couple travels to a remote Swedish village for a legendary midsummer festival. Their idyllic vacation turns into a violent and disturbing competition as they uncover the sinister traditions of the cult.
awards: Nominated for the Critics' Choice Movie Award for Best Sci-Fi/Horror Movie

title: Everything Everywhere All at Once
movie_plot: A Chinese immigrant is swept up in a wild adventure, where she alone can save the world by exploring other universes and connecting with the lives she could have lived.
awards: Won 7 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: Lady Bird
movie_plot: An artistically inclined teenager with a strong will and a rebellious nature navigates her turbulent relationship with her mother and her senior year of high school in Sacramento, California.
awards: Nominated for 5 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: Minari
movie_plot: A Korean-American family moves to a tiny farm in rural Arkansas in search of their own American Dream. Their family dynamics are tested with the arrival of their eccentric, foul-mouthed grandmother.
awards: Won the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress (Youn Yuh-jung)

title: The Killing of a Sacred Deer
movie: The Killing of a Sacred Deer
movie_plot: A surgeon's life spirals into chaos when a young man he has taken under his wing begins to make strange demands. He is forced to make a horrifying sacrifice to save his family.
awards: Won Best Screenplay at the 2017 Cannes Film Festival

title: Good Time
movie_plot: After a botched bank robbery, a small-time criminal embarks on a frantic and dangerous journey through New York's underworld to get his mentally disabled brother out of jail.
awards: Nominated for the Palme d'Or at the 2017 Cannes Film Festival

title: The Favourite
movie_plot: In 18th-century England, a frail Queen Anne is on the throne, but her closest friend and advisor, Lady Sarah, governs the country in her place. The arrival of a new servant turns the political landscape into a fierce rivalry.
awards: Won the Academy Award for Best Actress (Olivia Colman)

title: The Social Network
movie_plot: The story of Facebook's creation, from the moment a brilliant but arrogant Harvard student decides to create a social network, to the legal battles and betrayals that followed.
awards: Won 3 Academy Awards, including Best Adapted Screenplay

title: The Revenant
writer: Mark L. Smith, Alejandro G. Iñárritu
movie_plot: Based on a true story, a frontiersman is mauled by a bear and left for dead by his hunting party. He must fight his way through the wilderness to find revenge on the man who betrayed him.
awards: Won 3 Academy Awards, including Best Director and Best Actor (Leonardo DiCaprio)

title: Dunkirk
movie_plot: The story of the evacuation of Allied soldiers from the beaches of Dunkirk during World War II. The film is told from three different perspectives: the land, the sea, and the air.
awards: Won 3 Academy Awards, including Best Sound Mixing

title: The Post
movie_plot: The story of the Washington Post's publisher, Katharine Graham, and editor, Ben Bradlee, and their decision to publish the Pentagon Papers, exposing a government cover-up of four decades of secrets.
awards: Nominated for an Academy Award for Best Picture

title: Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri
movie_plot: A mother rents three billboards to challenge the local police to solve her daughter's murder case. Her bold move ignites a war between her and the town's chief of police.
awards: Won 2 Academy Awards, including Best Actress (Frances McDormand)

title: The Big Sick
movie_plot: A Pakistani-American stand-up comedian falls in love with a white American woman. Their relationship is complicated by his family's strict traditional values, but they are brought together when she falls into a mysterious coma.
awards: Nominated for an Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay

title: Perfect Blue
movie_plot: A former pop idol retires to pursue an acting career. As she takes on a psychologically demanding role, she becomes increasingly unhinged and paranoid, unsure of what is real and what is a fantasy.
awards: Widely influential and praised for its complex themes

title: The Tale of the Princess Kaguya
movie: The Tale of the Princess Kaguya
movie_plot: Based on a 10th-century Japanese folk tale, a young bamboo cutter finds a tiny baby girl in a glowing bamboo stalk. She grows at an incredible rate and is soon courted by many suitors, but she longs for her true home.
awards: Nominated for the Academy Award for Best Animated Feature

title: The Wind Rises
movie_plot: A fictionalized biography of Jiro Horikoshi, the designer of the Zero fighter plane used by the Japanese in World War II. The film explores his dreams, his love, and the complex relationship between art and destruction.
awards: Nominated for the Academy Award for Best Animated Feature

title: The Raid: Berandal
movie_plot: A rookie cop goes undercover to infiltrate a brutal crime syndicate. His mission leads him into a complex web of betrayal, gang wars, and a dangerous quest to uncover police corruption.
awards: Nominated for Best Action Film at the 2014 Saturn Awards

title: Princess Mononoke
movie_plot: A young warrior is cursed after a battle with a demon. He must journey to a sacred forest to find a cure and is caught in the middle of a conflict between the human world and the spirits of the forest.
awards: Won the Japan Academy Prize for Picture of the Year

title: Eighth Grade
movie_plot: A 13-year-old girl navigates the final week of her disastrous eighth-grade year before she embarks on the terrifying journey of high school. The film is a poignant and hilarious look at the awkwardness of puberty.
awards: Won Best First Film at the 2018 National Board of Review Awards

title: Uncut Gems
writer: Josh Safdie, Benny Safdie, Ronald Bronstein
movie_plot: A charismatic and reckless New York jeweler must make a series of high-stakes bets to pay off his debts. His life spirals out of control as he gambles on a rare opal.
awards: Won Best Actor (Adam Sandler) at the 2020 Independent Spirit Awards

title: The Farewell
movie_plot: A Chinese-American family hides the fact that their beloved grandmother has only a short time to live. They plan a big family reunion to say their goodbyes, without the grandmother's knowledge.
awards: Won the Golden Globe for Best Actress – Motion Picture Comedy or Musical (Awkwafina)

title: The Witch
movie_plot: A Puritan family is cast out of their community and settles on a remote farm in the 17th century. They are plagued by a supernatural evil, forcing them to question their faith and their sanity.
awards: Won Best First Feature at the 2016 Independent Spirit Awards

title: Pather Panchali
movie_plot: The first film in the Apu Trilogy, this film follows the impoverished life of a young boy named Apu and his family in a rural village in Bengal. The film is a poetic and emotional look at childhood and poverty.
awards: Won the Best Human Document award at the 1956 Cannes Film Festival

title: The Apu Trilogy: Aparajito
movie_plot: The second film in the Apu Trilogy, this film continues the story of Apu, who has moved to the city with his parents. He faces new challenges and learns about life, death, and responsibility.
awards: Won the Golden Lion at the 1957 Venice Film Festival

title: The Apu Trilogy: The World of Apu
movie_plot: The final film in the Apu Trilogy, this film follows Apu as he embarks on his journey to become a writer. He finds love, marries, and faces the new challenges of adulthood.
awards: Won Best Film at the 1960 National Film Awards

title: Thondimuthalum Driksakshiyum
movie_plot: A newlywed couple on a bus is robbed of a gold chain. The suspect, a small-time thief, swallows the chain and is taken to the police station. The film follows the absurd events that follow.
awards: Won 2 National Film Awards, including Best Feature Film in Malayalam

title: Kaaka Muttai
movie_plot: Two slum-dwelling brothers develop a craving for pizza after seeing it in a TV commercial. They embark on a hilarious and heartwarming quest to get their first slice, learning about poverty, class, and friendship.
awards: Won 2 National Film Awards, including Best Children's Film

title: Sairat
movie_plot: A wealthy upper-caste girl and a poor lower-caste boy fall in love. They are forced to flee their village when their romance is discovered, leading them on a tragic journey of survival.
awards: Won the National Film Award – Special Mention

title: Airlift
movie_plot: Based on a true story, a wealthy Indian businessman helps evacuate over 170,000 Indians from Kuwait during the 1990 Invasion of Kuwait. He risks his life to save his countrymen in a daring mission.
awards: Won Best Actor (Akshay Kumar) at the 62nd National Film Awards

title: Barfi!
movie_plot: The story of a deaf and mute boy named Barfi and his two love interests. The film is a charming and heartwarming tale of love, friendship, and happiness.
awards: Won 7 Filmfare Awards, including Best Film

title: Kahaani
writer: Sujoy Ghosh, Suresh Nair, Ritesh Shah
movie_plot: A pregnant woman arrives in Kolkata to search for her missing husband. She navigates the dangerous streets and corrupt officials to find him, but a deeper conspiracy awaits her.
awards: Won 5 National Film Awards, including Best Screenplay

title: Queen
writer: Vikas Bahl, Chaitally Parmar, Parvez Shaikh
movie_plot: A young Punjabi woman, whose wedding is called off, decides to go on her planned honeymoon to Paris and Amsterdam alone. Her journey becomes a coming-of-age story of self-discovery and freedom.
awards: Won 6 Filmfare Awards, including Best Film

title: PK
movie_plot: An alien arrives on Earth to study humanity, but he is stranded when his remote control is stolen. He embarks on a quest to find his way back home, questioning religion and superstitions along the way.
awards: Highest-grossing Indian film of 2014

title: Udaan
movie_plot: A young boy is expelled from his boarding school and is forced to return to his small town. He must live with his abusive father and finds a way to escape his oppressive reality and pursue his dreams.
awards: Won 7 Filmfare Awards, including Best Film

title: Chak De! India
movie_plot: A former hockey star, who was disgraced after losing a match, becomes the coach of the Indian women's hockey team. He must train a group of diverse and undisciplined girls to win the World Cup.
awards: Won the National Film Award for Best Popular Film Providing Wholesome Entertainment

title: 3 Idiots
movie_plot: Two friends embark on a search for their long-lost college friend, who inspired them to think differently. Their journey takes them back to their college days, where they revisit their memories and friendship.
awards: Won 6 Filmfare Awards, including Best Film

title: Lage Raho Munna Bhai
movie_plot: A kind-hearted mobster begins to see the spirit of Mahatma Gandhi. He uses Gandhi's non-violent philosophy to help people and solve their problems, leading to a hilarious and heartfelt journey.
awards: Won the National Film Award for Best Popular Film Providing Wholesome Entertainment

title: Khosla Ka Ghosla!
movie_plot: A retired middle-class man's life savings are stolen by a swindling builder who has illegally occupied his plot of land. He and his family must find a way to get their property back and get revenge on the builder.
awards: Won the National Film Award for Best Feature Film in Hindi

title: Hera Pheri
movie_plot: Three desperate and unemployed men are in search of money. They accidentally get their hands on a ransom call, and they must find a way to make money out of the situation, leading to hilarious chaos.
awards: Considered a cult classic of Indian cinema

title: Bajrangi Bhaijaan
movie_plot: A devout Hindu man from India embarks on a journey to Pakistan to return a mute girl to her home. He faces numerous challenges, including crossing the border and dealing with the political tensions between the two countries.
awards: Won the National Film Award for Best Popular Film Providing Wholesome Entertainment

title: Dev.D
movie_plot: A modern and dark adaptation of the classic Bengali novel 'Devdas'. The film follows a young man's descent into self-destruction and addiction after his childhood love leaves him.
awards: Won Best Actress (Kalki Koechlin) at the 55th Filmfare Awards

title: Black Friday
movie_plot: Based on a book, the film chronicles the events leading up to the 1993 Bombay bomb blasts. The film is told from the perspectives of the police, the criminals, and the victims, revealing a complex web of conspiracy and betrayal.
awards: Won the Grand Jury Prize at the 2005 Indian Film Festival of Los Angeles

title: Taare Zameen Par
movie_plot: A young boy with dyslexia is sent to a boarding school, where he is misunderstood and labeled as a troublemaker. His life changes when a new art teacher recognizes his struggles and helps him to overcome them.
awards: Won the National Film Award for Best Film on Family Welfare

title: Gully Boy
movie_plot: A young man from a Mumbai slum wants to become a rapper. He must navigate the challenges of his impoverished life, his overbearing father, and his own self-doubt to achieve his dreams.
awards: Won 13 Filmfare Awards, including Best Film

title: Tumbbad
writer: Rahi Anil Barve, Mitesh Shah, Anand Gandhi
movie_plot: A man's greed for a hidden treasure leads him to an ancient curse and a demon that he must battle. The film is a dark and terrifying fairy tale about the human desire for more.
awards: Widely praised for its unique visual style and storytelling

title: Dune
writer: Jon Spaihts, Denis Villeneuve, Eric Roth
movie_plot: In the distant future, a young man from a noble family is entrusted with the protection of the most valuable resource in the galaxy. He must navigate a dangerous world of betrayal, politics, and a hidden power that could change the universe.
awards: Won 6 Academy Awards, including Best Original Score

title: No Time to Die
writer: Neal Purvis, Robert Wade, Cary Joji Fukunaga
movie_plot: James Bond has left active service and is enjoying a tranquil life in Jamaica. His peace is short-lived when his old friend Felix Leiter from the CIA comes asking for help.
awards: Won the Academy Award for Best Original Song

title: The Matrix Resurrections
writer: Lana Wachowski, David Mitchell, Aleksandar Hemon
movie_plot: Thomas Anderson, also known as Neo, is back to his mundane life in San Francisco. When he is given a new pill, he must choose whether to follow the white rabbit and discover the truth about the Matrix.
awards: Nominated for a Saturn Award for Best Science Fiction Film

title: Top Gun: Maverick
writer: Ehren Kruger, Eric Warren Singer, Christopher McQuarrie
movie_plot: After more than 30 years of service, Maverick is still pushing the limits as a naval aviator. He is tasked with training a new team of graduates for a high-stakes mission.
awards: Nominated for 6 Academy Awards, including Best Picture

title: All We Imagine as Light
movie_plot: Two nurses from Kerala, living in Mumbai, are tired of their mundane lives. They embark on a road trip to a coastal town, where they find a new sense of freedom and hope.
awards: Won the Grand Prix at the 2024 Cannes Film Festival

title: Sakra
movie_plot: Based on a martial arts novel, the film follows a martial arts master who is wrongfully accused of murder. He must fight his way through a dangerous world to clear his name and uncover a conspiracy.
awards: Nominated for Best Action Film at the 2024 Hong Kong Film Awards

title: A Bittersweet Life
movie_plot: A mob enforcer is ordered by his boss to dispose of his boss's mistress. He disobeys the order and is forced to go on the run from his former allies, leading to a brutal and bloody war.
awards: Won Best Director at the 2005 Chunsa Film Art Awards

title: The Admiral: Roaring Currents
movie_plot: Based on a true story, a brilliant but disgraced admiral is tasked with defending his country against a massive Japanese fleet with only 12 ships. He must use his strategic genius to defeat the enemy and save his country.
awards: Highest-grossing film in South Korean history

title: War of the Arrows
movie_plot: During the Second Manchu invasion of Korea, a master archer is on a quest to rescue his sister who has been taken captive. He must use his archery skills to defeat a brutal enemy and save his family.
awards: Won Best Actor (Park Hae-il) at the 48th Grand Bell Awards

title: Mother
movie_plot: A mother's life is turned upside down when her mentally disabled son is accused of murder. She embarks on a desperate and dangerous quest to prove his innocence, uncovering dark secrets in her village.
awards: Won Best Film at the 2009 Buil Film Awards

title: Jailer
movie_plot: A retired police officer and family man is living a peaceful life until his son, a cop, goes missing. He is forced to confront his past and use his criminal network to save his son.
awards: Highest-grossing Tamil film of 2023

title: Ponniyin Selvan: II
writer: Mani Ratnam, Elango Kumaravel, B. Jeyamohan
movie_plot: The continuation of the epic saga of the Chola prince and his quest for the throne. The film concludes the political intrigues and battles, leading to the coronation of the rightful king.
awards: Won Best Film at the 69th Filmfare Awards South

title: Vikram
movie_plot: A black-ops agent investigates a series of brutal murders committed by a masked gang. He uncovers a drug cartel that has been operating in the city and goes on a rampage to take them down.
awards: One of the highest-grossing Tamil films of all time

title: Soorarai Pottru
movie_plot: Based on a true story, a common man with a big dream of starting a low-cost airline faces numerous challenges and obstacles. He must fight against the corrupt system and an airline tycoon to achieve his dream.
awards: Won 5 National Film Awards, including Best Feature Film

title: Chhichhore
writer: Nitesh Tiwari, Piyush Gupta, Nikhil Mehrotra
movie_plot: A group of college friends reunite to help one of them get through a difficult time. They reminisce about their college days and the lessons they learned about success and failure.
awards: Won the National Film Award for Best Feature Film in Hindi

title: Bala
movie_plot: A young man who is suffering from premature baldness becomes a laughingstock in his community. He must overcome his insecurities and learn to accept himself for who he is.
awards: Nominated for Best Film at the 65th Filmfare Awards

title: Dream Girl
movie_plot: A young man with a unique talent for mimicking a woman's voice gets a job at a call center. He becomes a sensation as a 'dream girl,' but his new identity leads to hilarious complications and unexpected love.
awards: Won Best Film at the 65th Filmfare Awards

title: Super Deluxe
movie_plot: Four parallel stories intersect in a series of strange and unexpected events. A man returning home as a transgender woman, a young couple trying to hide a murder, and a family's encounter with a spiritual guru.
awards: Won the National Film Award for Best Original Screenplay

title: Maheshinte Prathikaaram
movie_plot: A humble photographer is publicly humiliated in a fight. He vows to not wear his slippers until he gets revenge on the man who beat him. His quest for revenge leads him on a journey of self-discovery.
awards: Won 2 National Film Awards, including Best Feature Film in Malayalam

title: E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial
movie_plot: A lonely boy befriends a lost alien who is stranded on Earth. He and his siblings must find a way to help the alien return to his home planet while keeping him hidden from the authorities.
awards: Won 4 Academy Awards, including Best Original Score

title: Jurassic Park
movie_plot: A wealthy eccentric creates a theme park with genetically engineered dinosaurs. The park's grand opening goes horribly wrong when the prehistoric creatures break free and go on a rampage.
awards: Won 3 Academy Awards, including Best Sound Mixing

title: The Devil Wears Prada
movie_plot: A young and ambitious journalist gets a job as an assistant to a tyrannical editor-in-chief of a prestigious fashion magazine. She must survive her boss's ruthless demands while navigating the cutthroat world of fashion.
awards: Nominated for 2 Academy Awards, including Best Actress (Meryl Streep)

title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
writer: Charlie Kaufman, Michel Gondry, Pierre Bismuth
movie: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
movie_plot: After a painful breakup, a man and his ex-girlfriend erase their memories of each other. He embarks on a journey through his mind to relive their memories and finds himself fighting to hold on to them.
awards: Won the Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay
